author: andschwa

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body:
Hi **@andschwa**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution!

It looks like you're a Microsoft contributor (Andy Schwartzmeyer). If you're full-time, we DON'T require a Contribution License Agreement. If you are a vendor, please DO sign the electronic Contribution License Agreement. It will take 2 minutes and there's no faxing! https://cla.microsoft.com.

TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Push build succeeded. Pester tests ran and AppImage was created successfully.

comments.author: probonopd
comments.body: Thanks, looks good to me.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @TravisEz13 ah, of course. Here's an upstream [build](https://travis-ci.org/PowerShell/PowerShell/builds/155773444) which should upload the artifacts when its complete.

comments.body:
@probonopd I have a hold that came internally, we can't merge this yet.

@KrisBash can you please explain?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @KrisBash nevermind, I spoke with @probonopd.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
Hm, I can't assign @KrisBash to the issue.

@lzybkr should we add him as a collaborator?

comments.author: zaxebo1
comments.body:
I am using powershell AppImage on linux , available at https://bintray.com/probono/AppImages/PowerShell .  It helps in single portable binary executable file getting executed on various linux distributions. 

**I will humbly request and very strongly recommend that each powershell release by the powershell development team, should also officially happen in AppImage format , and should be available officially at https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases**

Please merge the pull request as soon as possible and release it in Powershell 6.0

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Hello, and thank you for your input @zaxebo1. I am following up internally on why this is still blocked; we should have a better answer here soon. Thanks again :smile:

comments.body: Working on getting resolution on this, won't happen til next week earliest

comments.author: andschwa

comments.body: @andschwa this has been approved, but we must include some attribution, I'll send them to you via email to include in the image

comments.author: zaxebo1
comments.body: the above are **trivial conflicts** - that is, conflicts only in markdown files and a shell script, which can be quickly resolved. Request you to kindly take up  on early/priority - to resolve these conflicting files

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
- [x] Rebased and merge conflicts resolved
- [x] Pinned external code download to specific commit hash
- [x] Included additional third party licenses from legal
- [x] Successful build of AppImage binary
- [ ] Anything else?

@PowerShell/powershell-maintainers you'll want to include the AppImage binary in the next release on GitHub, and fix the link in the readme.
